Original Loan Amount = $7,076,683  
Additional Interest Rate = 2%   
Additional Interest Cost ($) = Original Loan Amount × Additional Interest Rate / 100    
                            ≈ $7,076,683 × 2 / 100     
                            ≈ $141,534      
Thus, the total debt becomes roughly $7,218,217 (= $7,076,683 + $141,534). direct_answer.text: First, calculate the initial loan plus interest: $7076683 + ($7076683 * 0.02) = $7076683 + $141534 = $7218217. Since Stephen pays $25 per month for 11 months, he pays a total of $25 * 11 = $275 over these months. Subtract this payment from the total debt to find out how much is still owed after 11 months: $7218217 - $275 = $7217942. Therefore, Stephen will need to repay $7217942 in the twelfth month. The answer is: $7217942.

direct_answer.text: First let's calculate the interest which Steven needs to repay along with principal i.e., initial loan. Interest = Principal Amount (P) × Rate(R)/NumberOfYears(N). Here P=$7076683 , R=2%, N=1/12 . Thus I=[$7076683×(2÷100)]/(12)= $11794. To find out what would Steve need to pay back we add this value to original debt : New Debt+Interest=(Initial Loan+$ Interests )= ($7076683+$11794) = $7087877 This is the entire sum due but not yet because over next yearly period Stephan pays off part of debt every month so lets subtract all these values until month eleven as well.(NewDebt-(MonthlyPayment*month))for first 11months:(($7087877)-[$25*(Jan)+...+(Dec)*1]=(($7087877)-[($25*$1)+......($25)$1
